title: Advanced HTML Tags -2
description: Advanced HTML tags for enhanced web functionality and semantics.

cards.q: What is the <canvas> tag used for?
cards.a: The <canvas> tag is used to draw graphics on the fly via scripting (usually JavaScript).
The <svg> tag defines scalable vector graphics directly in the HTML document.
The <details> tag creates a disclosure widget that users can open or close to view additional information.
The <summary> tag provides a visible heading for the <details> element.
The <mark> tag highlights text for reference or emphasis.
The <time> tag represents a specific time or date, machine-readable for programs.

cards.q: What is the purpose of the <meter> tag?
cards.a: The <meter> tag represents a scalar measurement within a known range, like disk usage or temperature.

cards.q: How is the <progress> tag different from <meter>?
cards.a: The <progress> tag shows progress towards a task completion as a bar.
The <template> tag holds HTML content that is not rendered immediately but can be cloned and inserted later via script.

cards.q: What is the use of the <slot> tag in Web Components?
cards.a: The <slot> tag is a placeholder inside a Web Component for external content to be inserted.
